result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre Vercale Salton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Comply with rules set by the probation agent.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre Vercale Salton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for 10 days time served. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS with the following conditions: 

- Seek/Maintain Full Time employment.
- Comply with rules set by the probation agent.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- No contact with illegal drugs.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Andre Vercale Salton in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Side bar placed on the record.
AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated May 19, 2015 received and filed. tk
$25.00 Cash bond forfeited per court order.

All conditions to remain the same. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Andre Vercale Salton in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Case in court due to violation: Drug Test - Diluted; Drug Test - Positive.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court forfeited $25.00 of $100.00 bail posted. Court amends cash bail to $75.00.  Case remains calendared for projected plea and sentencing in Branch 17.

Same appearances.
Upon questioning, Court finds the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to testify.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed. Arguments by state and defense. Defense request case be set for projected plea and sentencing. Defendant advised he must report to Justice Point after court today.

Defendant Andre Vercale Salton in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 Court ordered witnesses must not discuss case during hearing. Sworn for the state:  Matthew Vandrisse, Officer- MPD; Joel Susler, Officer- MPD.  State rests subject to rebuttal. Case passed. 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated May 11, 2015 received and filed. tk
State's Response to Defendant's Motion and Motion to Suppress, received and filed.
Motion to Suppress Physical Evidence-Illegal Stop, Search, and Seizure, received and filed.

Defendant Andre Vercale Salton in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing. Defense filed motion. Case is adjourned for Motion Hearing on 5-12-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. 
Any response from the State is due no later than 4-10-2015 by 5:00 p.m.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated March 9, 2015, received and filed.

Defendant Andre Vercale Salton in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Original Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant pled not guilty. States files Judgment of Conviction for case 2008CF2936, copy given to Defense. Defense requests case be set for Projected Plea and Sentencing.
Case is adjourned for Projected Plea and Sentencing on 3-10-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. 
Any Defense motion is due no later than 3-10-2015 by 8:30 a.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Calendar call scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated February 10, 2015, received and filed.

Defendant Andre Vercale Salton in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Andre Vercale Salton in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Arraignment scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM005139  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-03-2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing    
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Andre Vercale Salton in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Andre Vercale Salton in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
